notesStmt.note: Imperfect at the beginning and at the end. Lacuna after folio 96.
Manuscript description based on Margoliouth, G.: Catalogue of the Hebrew and Samaritan Manuscripts in the British Museum, London 1965.

msContents.summary: Midrash ha-ḥefets, a philosophical midrash on the Pentateuch by Zechariah ben Solomon ha-Rofe, aka Yaḥya ben Saliman.

collation.p: Quires (originally 23) of mostly 10 leaves each. Signatures in Hebrew letters at the beginning and at the end of quires.

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Yemenite semi-cursive script of 15 to 16th century.

binding.p: BM/BL in-house. Spine title: 'Midrash ha-Chefets. Hebrew and Arabic. Brit. Mus. Oriental 2380.'

history.provenance: Acquisition: Moses Wilhelm Shapira (b. 1830, d. 1884), an antiquities dealer of Jerusalem: purchased by the British Library from him on 23 July 1881: inscribed, folio [226v].
